name: ampere
defn: SI base unit for the electric current (symbol: A). The ampere is that constant current which, if maintained in two straight parallel conductors of infinite length, of negligible circular cross-section, and placed 1 metre apart in vacuum, would produce between these conductors a force equal to 2 x 10E-7newton per metre of length (9th CGPM, 1948).

name: ångström
defn: Non-SI unit of length, Å = 10E-10 m, widely used in molecular physics.

name: atmosphere
defn: Non-SI unit of pressure, 1 atm = 101,325 Pa.

name: bar
defn: Non-SI unit of pressure, bar = 10E5 Pa.

name: barn
defn: Non-SI unit of area, b = 10E-28 m2, used to express cross sections in nuclear reactions.

name: becquerel
defn: SI derived unit of radioactivity equal to one disintegration per second; admitted for reasons of safeguarding human health, symbol: Bq.

name: bohr
defn: Atomic unit of length, .

name: calorie
defn: Non-SI unit of energy. There are three differently defined calories: thermochemical calorie (calth = 4.184 J), international steam table calorie (calIT = 4.1868 J), 15°C calorie (cal15 = 4.1855 J), however only the symbol cal is usually used.

name: candela
defn: SI base unit for luminous intensity (symbol: cd). The candela is the luminous intensity, in a given direction, of a source that emits monochromatic radiation of frequency 540 x 10E12 hertz and that has a radiant intensity in that direction of (1/683) watt per steradian.

name: clausius
defn: Non-SI unit of entropy, Cl = 4.184 J K-1.

name: coefficient of haze
defn: One technique of measurement of the amount of filterable particulate matter suspended in air which has been used in the past depends upon drawing a measured sample of air (usually 1 000 linear feet) through a paper or membranefilter. A measurement is made of the intensity of light transmitted through the dust spot formed relative to that transmitted through an identical clean filter. The dirtiness of the air is reported in terms of the COH unit. This relates to the quantity of particulate material which produces an optical density, log 10 ( I 0 I ) and relative to the transmission of an identical dust-free filter taken as 100%. Thus a filter which transmitted 50% relative to the clean filter has an absorbance of 0.301 or 30.1 COH units. This is not a recommended measure of filterable particulate matter since the size, colour and other properties of the aerosol and the air in which it is suspended affect the results.

name: coulomb
defn: SI derived unit of electric charge, C = A.s.

name: curie
defn: Non-SI unit of radioactivity, Ci ≈ 3.7 x 10E10 Bq.

name: dalton
defn: Non-SI unit of mass (symbol Da), equal to the unified atomic mass unit (atomic mass constant). It is often used in biochemistry and molecular biology although it was never approved by the Conférence Général des Poids et Mesures.

name: day
defn: Non-SI unit of time, d = 86400 s. The day is not exactly defined in terms of the second since so-called leap seconds are added or subtracted from the day semiannually in order to keep the annual average occurrence of midnight at 24:00 on the clock.

name: debye
defn: Non-SI unit of electric dipole moment. It is equal to the electric dipole moment for two charges of 10E-10 franklin separated by 1 ångström,D = 10E-18 Fr cm ≈ 3.33564 x 10E-30 C m.

name: decibel
defn: Non-SI unit for expressing power levels, dB = 0.1151293 Np.

name: degree
defn: Non-SI unit of plane angle, 1° = (π/180)rad ≈ 0.01745329... rad.

name: degree Celsius
defn: SI derived unit of Celsius temperature equal to the kelvin (symbol: °C).

name: degree Fahrenheit
defn: Non-SI unit of Fahrenheit temperature, °F = 5/9 K. The Fahrenheit temperature is related to the Celsius temperature by θF/°F = 9/5.(θ/°C) + 32.

name: Dobson unit
defn: Unit sometimes used in the description of the total ozone in a column of air overhead. It is given as the thickness (in units of 10E-3 cm or 10E-5 m) of that layer which would be formed by the total ozone in a column reduced to the pressure of 760 Torr and temperature of 0°C.

name: dyne
defn: cgs unit of force, dyn = 10E-5 N.

name: electronvolt
defn: Non-SI unit of energy, eV ≈ 1.602176487(40) x 10E-19 J.

name: entropy unit
defn: Non-SI unit of molar entropy, e.u. = 4.184 J K-1 mol-1.

name: erg
defn: cgs unit of energy, erg = 10E-7 J.

name: farad
defn: SI derived unit of electric capacitance, F = C V^-1 = m^-2 kg^-1 s^4 A^2.

name: fermi
defn: Non-SI unit of length, f = 10E-15 m, used in nuclear physics.

name: foot
defn: Non-SI unit of length, ft = 12 in = 0.3048 m.

name: franklin
defn: esu unit of electric charge, Fr ≈ 3.33564 x 10E-10 C.

name: gauss
defn: emu unit of magnetic flux density, G = 10E-4 T.

name: gram
defn: cgs base unit of mass, g = 10E-3 kg.

name: gray
defn: SI derived unit of energy imparted to an element of matter by ionizing radiation divided by the mass of that element (absorbed dose of radiation) equal to one joule per kilogram and admitted for reasons of safeguarding human health, Gy = J kg-1.

name: hertz
defn: SI derived unit of frequency equal to one cycle per second, Hz = s-1.

name: hour
defn: Non-SI unit of time, h = 3600 s.

name: inch
defn: Non-SI unit of length, in = 0.0254 m.

name: joule
defn: SI derived unit of energy, J = N m = kg m 2 s-2.

name: katal
defn: Unit for catalytic activity coherent with the SI, equal to the catalytic activity that catalyses a reaction rate of one mole per second in an assay system. 1 kat = 1 mol s-1. The katal is recommended for use in the specific context of enzymes and clinical chemistry.

name: kelvin
defn: SI base unit of thermodynamic temperature (symbol: K). The kelvin is the fraction 1/273.16 of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water.

name: kilogram
defn: SI base unit for mass (symbol: kg). The kilogram is equal to the mass of the international prototype of the kilogram.

name: lumen
defn: SI derived unit of luminous flux, lm = cd sr.

name: lux
defn: SI derived unit of illuminance, lx = lm m-2 = cd sr m-2.

name: metre
defn: SI base unit for length (symbol: m). The metre is the length of path travelled by light in vacuum during a time interval of 1/299792458 of a second.

name: millimetre of mercury
defn: Non-SI unit for pressure; mmHg ≈ 133.322 Pa. This old unit is not recognized by CIPM or ISO, but it is used for blood pressure.

name: minute
defn: Non-SI unit of plane angle. .

name: mole
defn: SI base unit for the amount of substance (symbol: mol). The mole is the amount of substance of a system which contains as many elementary entities as there are atoms in 0.012 kilogram of carbon-12. When the mole is used, the elementary entities must be specified and may be atoms, molecules, ions, electrons, other particles, or specified groups of such particles.

name: neper
defn: Unit, coherent with the SI, for expressing field levels, Np = 1.

name: newton
defn: SI derived unit of force, N = kg m s-2.

name: ohm
defn: SI derived unit of electrical resistance, Ω = V A-1 = m 2 kg s-3 A-2.

name: pascal
defn: SI derived unit of pressure, Pa = N m-2 = kg m-1 s-2.

name: poise
defn: cgs unit of dynamic viscosity, P = 0.1 Pa s.

name: rad
defn: Non-SI unit of absorbed dose of radiation, rad = 0.01 Gy.

name: radian
defn: SI derived unit of plane angle, rad = 1.

name: rem
defn: Non-SI unit of dose equivalent (rem = 0.01 Sv).

name: röntgen
defn: Non-SI unit of exposure to X- or γ-radiation: R = 2.58 x 10E-4 C kg.

name: second
defn: SI base unit of time (symbol: s). The second is the duration of 9 192 631 770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium-133 atom.

name: siemens
defn: SI derived unit of electric conductance, S = Ω-1 = m-2 kg-1 s 3 A 2.

name: sievert
defn: SI derived unit of dose equivalent (the mean specific energy imparted to an element of matter corrected by a quality factor and a modifying factor to take into account the properties of irradiated matter) equal to one joule per kilogram and admitted for reasons of safeguarding human health.

name: stokes
defn: cgs unit of kinematic viscosity, St = 10E-4 m^2 s^-1.

name: tesla
defn: SI derived unit of magnetic flux density, T = Wb m-2 = kg s-2 A-1.

name: tonne
defn: Non-SI unit of mass, t = 10 3 kg.

name: torr
defn: Non-SI unit of pressure, torr ≈ 133.322 Pa.

name: unified atomic mass unit
defn: Non-SI unit of mass (equal to the atomic mass constant), defined as one twelfth of the mass of a carbon-12 atom in its ground state and used to express masses of atomic particles, u ≈ 1.660 5402 10 x 10E-27 kg.

name: volt
defn: SI derived unit of electric potential, V = J C-1 = m 2 kg s-3 A-1.

name: watt
defn: SI derived unit of power, W = J s-1 = m 2 kg s-3.

name: weber
defn: SI derived unit of magnetic flux, Wb = V.s = m2 kg s-2 A-1.

name: x unit
defn: Non-SI unit of length: X ≈ 1.002 x 10E-13 m .

name: yard
defn: Non-SI unit of length, yd = 3 ft = 0.9144 m.

name: year
defn: Non-SI unit of time, a = 31556952 s. The year is not commensurable with the day and not a constant. The value given corresponds to the Gregorian calendar year (a = 365.2425 d).
